medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented for surgical resection of stage IA non-small cell lung cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with non-small cell lung cancer prior to surgery. Postoperatively, a Brugada pattern became evident on electrocardiogram. Symptoms related to hyperkalemia, such as oliguric renal failure and hyperglycemia, were managed, and the electrocardiogram normalized 48 hours later without any symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type I diabetes mellitus, hypothyroidism, emphysema, and a distant history of cholangiocarcinoma treated with surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation.
medical_history.social_history: 30-pack-year smoking history; stopped using tobacco 20 years ago.
